item.title: Quick Start
item.description: System requirements Dependent on R (>= 3.3.0) If you did not install the R software yet,you can download R >= 3.3.0 from https://www.r-project.org Opening the GUI Install the latest version of “statTarget 2.0” at Github. copy this code into R # Install package dependencies source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R") biocLite(c("randomForest", "plyr", "pdist", "ROC", "rrcov", "pls", "impute", "gWidgets2", "gWidgets2RGtk2")) # Install devtools install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) # Install statTarget 2.0 devtools::install_github("13479776/statarget", build_vignettes=TRUE) library(statTarget) ## `Load statTarget` statTargetGUI() ## `Execute statTarget GUI` For mac PC, XQuartz instead of X11 support should be installed.

item.title: Featured Articles
item.description: 2017 1 NOREVA: normalization and evaluation of MS-based metabolomics data. Nucleic Acids Res 2017 gkx449. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkx449 2 Endocrinology Meets Metabolomics: Achievements, Pitfalls, and Challenges. Trends in Endocrinology & Metabolism 2017 doi: dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.tem.2017.07.001 3 Review of emerging metabolomic tools and resources: 2015–2016. ELECTROPHORESIS 2017 doi: 10.1002/elps.201700110 4 NormalizeMets: Analysis of Metabolomics Data. R package 2017

item.title: Vignette
item.description: Welcome to statTarget 2.0! An easy to use tool provides graphical user interface for quality control based signal correction, integration of metabolomics and proteomics data from multi-batch experiments, and the comprehensive statistic analysis in non-targeted or targeted metabolomics and proteomics. Metabolomics and proteomics Metabolomics and proteomics are powerful ‘omics’ approaches that aims to analyze all small molecules or proteins in a biological sample comprehensively. The molecular profiling of thousands of biological samples has great potential for directly elucidating disease processes.

item.title: Demo
item.description: Demo data Download the Example data. PhenoFile.csv (MetaFile.csv) for Signal Correction statFile_raw.csv for Statistic Analysis

item.title: About us
item.description: statTarget Project: statTarget is currently updated and maintained by Hemi Luan (hemi.luan@gamil.com) in SKLEBA at Hong Kong Baptsit Univeristy. Mass spectrometry based metabolomics: SKLEBA has established a proteomics and metabolomics analysis platform with multiple analytical instruments capable of exploring different chemicals, environmental pollutants, toxins. The facilities greatly improve the qualitative and quantitative accuracy in proteomics and metabolomics. The analytical instruments include: UPLC - Q Exactive Focus Hybrid Quadrupole-Orbitrap Mass Spectrometer (1) UPLC - TSQ Quantiva Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometer (1) UPLC - Orbitrap Fusion Tribrid Mass Spectrometer (1) Rapiflex MALDI Tissuetyper Imaging Mass Spectrometer (1) UPLC – Triple Quadrupole Mass spectrometer (2) Publications Luan, H.
